intro: Tetracera podotricha, commonly known as the hairy tetracera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, green, ovate leaves with a hairy texture. The plant produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers, which are surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
